title: The Durability of Secular Humanism? Pt. 1 Nazis and Early Evolutionary Science
description:
The Unbelievable debate between Glen Scrivener and Matt Dillahunty really climaxed around secular humanism's durability. Dillahunty agreed that secular humanism is a product of Christian history (see Tom Holland's Dominion) but does it fray when it loses touch with it's religious roots? 

The Nazis (according to Tom Holland) stand in for evil and the demonic for receding Christianity. Why? Where the Nazis Christian? What did they really believe? What is the relationship between environmentalism and the Nazis? Where the Nazis simply racist? What is the relationship between early evolutionary science and the Nazis?
